description: Pumpkin is a Minecraft server built entirely in Rust, offering a fast, efficient, and customizable experience. It prioritizes performance and player enjoyment while adhering to the core mechanics of the game.

installation.script:
#!/bin/ash
# Pumpkin Installation Script
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server

set -e

ARCH=$(uname -m)
DOWNLOAD_URL=""

echo "Detected architecture: ${ARCH}"

if [ "${ARCH}" = "x86_64" ]; then
    DOWNLOAD_URL="https://github.com/Pumpkin-MC/Pumpkin/releases/download/nightly/pumpkin-X64-Linux"
elif [ "${ARCH}" = "aarch64" ] || [ "${ARCH}" = "arm64" ]; then
    DOWNLOAD_URL="https://github.com/Pumpkin-MC/Pumpkin/releases/download/nightly/pumpkin-ARM64-Linux"
else
    echo "Unsupported architecture: ${ARCH}"
    exit 1
fi

cd /mnt/server

echo "Downloading Pumpkin ${ARCH} from:"
echo "${DOWNLOAD_URL}"

if [ -f ${SERVER_FILENAME} ]; then
    mv ${SERVER_FILENAME} ${SERVER_FILENAME}.old
fi

curl -L "${DOWNLOAD_URL}" -o ${SERVER_FILENAME}
chmod +x ${SERVER_FILENAME}
echo "Downloaded Pumpkin file and made it executable."

echo "Now validating configs..."

# Ensure config folder exists
if [ ! -d "./config" ]; then
    echo "Creating ./config folder..."
    mkdir -p ./config
fi

# Ensure features.toml exists
if [ ! -f "./config/features.toml" ]; then
    echo "Downloading default features.toml..."
    curl -L -o ./config/features.toml \
    https://raw.githubusercontent.com/slash1div/pumpkin-mc-egg/refs/heads/main/features.toml
fi

# Ensure configuration.toml exists
if [ ! -f "./config/configuration.toml" ]; then
    echo "Downloading default configuration.toml..."
    curl -L -o ./config/configuration.toml \
    https://raw.githubusercontent.com/slash1div/pumpkin-mc-egg/refs/heads/main/configuration.toml
fi

echo "Configs validated."

echo "Pumpkin installation completed successfully."

variables.name: Server File Name
variables.description:
Server File Name, by default this is set to 'pumpkin-server'.
Set it to otherwise if you wish to have a different file name.
Avoid adding any file extensions to the name.

variables.name: Bedrock Edition Port
variables.description:
Bedrock Edition Port, which allows Bedrock players to connect.
By default is set to 19132. Never set this to the same as your primary port.
Having the Java and Bedrock port the same will cause crashes / instability.
You can disable Bedrock connections in "config/configuration.toml" after install.
